body: @yegor256 please, pay attention to this issue

Job [#1301](https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/issues/1301) is now in scope, role is `DEV`

<!-- https://www.0crat.com/footprint/C9R53K5JA/00c792dd-ef3c-40c1-a7c0-683787588b74, version: 0.38.6, hash: ${buildNumber} -->

The job [#1301](https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/issues/1301) assigned to @paulodamaso[/z](https://www.0crat.com/u/paulodamaso), here is [why](https://www.0crat.com/footprint/C9R53K5JA/e3aa1690-c23e-4557-93ec-c3884ffcae4b); the budget is 30 minutes, see [ยง4](http://www.zerocracy.com/policy.html#4); please, read [ยง8](http://www.zerocracy.com/policy.html#8) and [ยง9](http://www.zerocracy.com/policy.html#9); if the task is not clear, read [this](http://www.yegor256.com/2015/02/16/it-is-not-a-school.html) and [this](http://www.yegor256.com/2015/01/15/how-to-cut-corners.html); there will be no monetary reward for this job

<!-- https://www.0crat.com/footprint/C9R53K5JA/ad6e9d80-2dc4-4dd1-aefa-6550cffe028a, version: 0.38.7, hash: ${buildNumber} -->

Job `gh:jcabi/jcabi-github#1301` already assigned to @paulodamaso, can't assign to @paulodamaso

<!-- https://www.0crat.com/footprint/C9R53K5JA/313ac20b-91ed-4309-a6a6-973f72a3bccd, version: 0.38.7, hash: ${buildNumber} -->
@paulodamaso only do the refactoring if it's possible without many changes. If many changes are required, then just remove the puzzle and let's leave it like that :)

@amihaiemil Well I don't see why refactor it for start. I think that this class is cohesive enough as it is, and this check is being too hard on it in my opinion.

Actually I think that an ideal number for this check would be 5 parameters, 3 I think that is too few.
@paulodamaso right, makes sense. Then just remove the puzzle (let's not increase the number of params for now) :)

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)
